techmeme.title: Sources: DOGE plans to build a centralized database with troves of personal information about millions of US residents, sometimes bypassing security protocols (Washington Post)
Sources: Robinhood plans a blockchain-based platform to let retail investors in Europe trade US securities, and considered partnerships with Arbitrum and Solana (Muyao Shen/Bloomberg)
Internal messages show how the US State Department, in conjunction with trade talks, pushed nations facing tariffs to clear regulatory hurdles for Starlink (Washington Post)
Sources: Meta is once again considering facial recognition for its smart glasses and other devices, after abandoning the idea over ethical concerns in 2021 (The Information)
Sen. Blumenthal says the Permanent Subcommittee on Investigations opened an inquiry into Trump's crypto empire, calling his memecoin dinner "pay-for-play" (MacKenzie Sigalos/CNBC)
